commands.description: Starts a local development server at http://localhost:8000.
Runs the database migrations to apply schema changes.
Creates a new Eloquent model file.
Generates a new controller file.
Rolls back the last batch of database migrations.
Seeds the database with records defined in seed classes.
Opens an interactive shell to interact with your Laravel application.
Displays a list of all registered routes in the application.
Creates a new migration file for the database schema.
Generates a new seeder class for inserting data into the database.
Drops all tables and re-runs all migrations from scratch.
Creates a new middleware class to handle request filtering logic.
Creates a cache file for faster configuration loading.
Clears the application cache.
Starts processing jobs in the queue.
Creates a symbolic link from public/storage to storage/app/public for file uploads.
Optimizes the framework by caching routes, config, and views.
Puts the application into maintenance mode.
Brings the application out of maintenance mode.
Generates a new form request class for validating incoming data.
